snippet: As the opposition struggled to select leaders, American intelligence detected that Syrian troops had mixed together small amounts of precursor chemicals for a deadly nerve gas.
abstract: Pressure is building on Syrian opposition coalition to choose leaders and transform itself into political force that could earn formal recognition from United States and other countries as viable alternative to Syrian government.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, MICHAEL R. GORDON and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, Lebanon; Michael R. Gordon from Brussels; and Christine Hauser from New York. Reporting was contributed by Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City; William Neuman from Caracas, Venezuela; Neil MacFarquhar from Beirut; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As the opposition struggled to select leaders, American intelligence detected that Syrian troops had mixed together small amounts of precursor chemicals for a deadly nerve gas.

headline.seo: Clinton Expresses Support for New Syrian Opposition Coalition
headline.main: Pressure Builds on Syrian Opposition Coalition; Fears of Chemical Weapons Rise
headline.print_headline: Pressure Builds on Syrian Opposition Coalition to Transform Into a Political Force

keywords.value: National Coalition of Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces
